eventName: So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home
storyInfo: Swire and Snowsant arrive in Siesta only to realize that their vehicle is being followed, so they force Enis to take them out on a 'joyride' to shake the pursuer. However, Bison meets them where their vehicle breaks down, saying that he's been waiting for them. In the Volcano Museum, Eyjafjalla sees a relic left behind by her parents and meets their old friend and curator, Keller.

attributes.text: Nowadays, most independent city-states have been swallowed up by larger powers or are on the brink of extinction, but Siesta is a unique example, a relic of the past embedded in the long southern coastline. It serves as an excellent case study in modern city-states.

attributes.content: Whoops, got it wrong again. Alright, this time from the top.
One, two, three...
Five thousand seven hundred sixty-one, five thousand seven hundred sixty-two... Also, didn't a few end up in Leithanien?
Well, whatever. Let them have their fun. It's about time those tall, ancient, goatee-shaped buildings got shaken up a bit, along with those people whose expressions are as crusty as their music.

Time is precious, or at least it is for them. If they can't concoct something new and exciting within the very limited time they have, then I'm going to be stuck here enduring years of stagnation and emptiness, dammit.

Times like these make me miss the days when I was getting chased around by those long-haired, sharp-fanged folk. But now, they seem to have invented a new game to play in Siracusa. They don't feel like playing with me anymore.
*sigh*... I should also find something fun to do.
The world is always full of twists and turns, and to exist means to change. Yet why do so many people find themselves in trouble because of these all-too-commonplace occurrences?

Just like building a house. It'll always go higher today than it was yesterday. Yet despite that, there are always people who want to go backwards and tear down the old parts. Seriously... spare me already.
If only these fragile and brief lives could last a bit longer, they would have the same wealth of wisdom as I. They would understand existence, or at least the purpose of existing.
I suppose only a few might be able to comprehend this truth, just like that song. How did it go again? The tune went something like laa laa laa... Hrmm...
Damn, forgot again.
Hello?
You again? I've seen your face more than once recently!
The volcano's about to blow, so turn yourself around and don't go any farther!
How many times do I have to tell you? There's nothing good about those black rocks over there, so why–
Ugh, forget it... Why can't they hear me until I get right up in their face? Isn't that a pain?
Well, best not to get too caught up in their lives anyway... Hope luck's on his side.
Umm, now where was I with my counting...?

attributes.text: Set out at seventeen in search for a home, still wand'ring today ♪
Show the fowlbeast the way, ask the adventurer for aid ♪
Trade treasures with a caravan, only to be left behind halfway ♪
I'll remember everyone I met, and give 'em a special name ♪
So no need to send me letters, no need for that I say ♪
Unless you find yourself like me, on some desolate road astray ♪

attributes.content: Not bad. That was a pretty popular tune twenty years ago.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Thanks for the compliment.
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: I hope this old-fashioned song didn't hurt your business.
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: Haha, that joke's not one bit funny. Take a look around us. Not a single tourist to be seen.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: The volcano drove away the Siestans, and the sun drove away the noisy tourists.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: All that's left is a leisure summer I haven't experienced in years, and a carefree happiness that's about to go bottoms-up.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: I assume you miss when Siesta was packed with tourists just a few years ago?
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: Who gets hung up on cash? What I miss is when people still had an artistic appreciation for rock n' roll.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: What people had back then was time and money, so they could sit down and talk about music and art in the abstract, their heads full of imagination for a fanciful future.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: It's just like they say. 'If you want to do art, you gotta fill your stomach first.'
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: The golden age of rock 'n roll is passed. Too many youngsters these days think the spirit of rock 'n' roll is restless beats and electronic reverb, the louder the better.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: But they forget the very beginning, when the longing for a kind of beauty that existed only in fantasy was part of the heart of rock n' roll.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Just like what you were playing before. I really dig those clean, elegant chords.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: It sounds like you know a lot about music. Do you play any instruments?
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: Bass and accordion.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Heheh, very trendy.
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: Play me another song, young lady. That last drink of yours is on me.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Thanks for the generosity. Now, I hope you don't mind if I charge a little extra for this next song? How does 'A Story' sound?
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: Hah, the old way of driving a bargain, huh?
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Young lady, where do you come from, and what should I call you?
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Byrd, from Columbia.
attributes.name: Guitar-Playing Singer

attributes.content: A Columbian, huh? I thought every Columbian was like a sand beast digging around in the wasteland, pouring all his time and effort into that place – just like my parents were.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: I'm also a pioneer, just a pioneer of the spirit.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: I want to see for myself what the Columbians of old saw when they came to this coast, and why they decided to settle here.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Then you're probably too late. That part of the coast has been abandoned at the foot of the volcano.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: What difference is there between this city built on a nomadic plate and a place like Columbia or Victoria?
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: What can we do about it? 'What the land gives, the land can also take away.'
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Which is why I'd love to hear the stories here, and get a glimpse into the past.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Alright. Then, let me tell you the story of how these stubborn people tried to move their volcanic hot springs and seaside Fashion Street to their new home, even after leaving the coastline.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Ugh... How did all the stuff I set up just fall over again...?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Not sure if it's heatstroke or what, but the last couple days, I've been seeing some strange shadows circling around my eyes.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Hey, young man, put all that work aside and come for a drink. Don't you hear the sun telling us it's a great day to kick back and relax?
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Oh, wait a sec, I think I recognize you. You're the young boss of the newly-opened trading company, aren't you? I bet you're planning to demolish this street, huh?
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Sir, this is just urban planning. We'll work hard to get everyone's consent, and we'll try our best to minimize the impact on your lives.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I'm sure we can smooth over any conflicts that might arise...
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: What is there to smooth over? If Herman wants to start a new business, he'll have to take apart our homes. If I was a few decades younger, I'd think about throwing a brick through his window.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: But the years really take a toll on you, and I don't have the energy anymore. So, whatever, do what you must.
attributes.name: An Elder by the Roadside

attributes.content: Excuse me, Commissioner Swire...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Snowsant... You don't need to call me out here.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Besides, my appointment as commissioner hasn't been announced yet. Why does it feel like the people around me are more anxious about it than I am?
attributes.name: Swire
Snowsant
attributes.content: Sorry, Com–

attributes.name: Snowsant
attributes.content: I mean, uh, I've never been on a vacation like this before...
Can I really buy so many things at a discount with this coupon? I was just picking up a year's supply of laundry detergent at the supermarket downstairs when I drew this...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: How is it possible? There's no such thing as a free lunch, right...? Wait, I heard there were some scams out there disguised as coupons just like these!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: It's probably Siesta's new marketing strategy, no? After leaving behind the old natural environment, the place needs some new ways of attracting tourists.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: MountainDash Logistics has formed a public-private partnership with Siesta, and they're also the ones who issued the coupons you've got there. Oh, and the company belongs to that Bison guy. I think you already know him.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If you find any false or misleading info on the coupons, the L.G.D. will be knocking on his door.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Right now, the two of us are elegant foreign tourists who just got back from a luxury mall shopping spree, and are sorting through their spoils.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Snowsant, can you hand me the perfume I just bought, and also a smaller screwdriver?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Y-Yes, ma'am! Right away!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Ehh...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hrmm...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: What are you doing, Miss Swire? Please keep your eyes on the road when you're driving...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: A citrus-toned perfume should perfectly compliment the sunset here. Say, the perfume you were staring at before is in that pink bag right there. Why don't you open it up and give it a smell? I think the floral tones will suit you perfectly.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: What?! N-No way! That's too expensive! How could I ever–
attributes.name: Snowsant
Swire
attributes.content: Don't stand on ceremony. It's not easy to find a good travelling companion, and there might be some things I need your help with later on...

attributes.name: Swire
attributes.content: Mind passing me the trumpet screwdriver again?
Heh, you sure did a good job keeping it hidden.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: What's that...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: A tracker with wiretapping capabilities. A previous-generation product that the L.G.D. phased out.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Eh? Didn't we come here to go on vacation? Why... What are we going to do now?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Don't you worry. This kind of stuff is easier than finding matching eyeshadow for me.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: So, what do you think, Snowsant? Do you like the perfume?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Yes! It smells great!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Then, we're all set.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Swire turns around, picks up her terminal, and enters a string of codes.
The tracker that has just been disassembled starts flashing in vain in the palm of its intended target.
After three busy signals, the person on the other side takes the call.
Hello...? Yeah, I've already arrived in Siesta.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Found some trash in the car though. Looks like they're really taking us seriously.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: No need to worry yourself over this. If anything, why don't you check if there aren't any surprises on your end?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: By the way... Since we're drawing this much attention as it is, we might need to meet up in advance.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Phew. Looks like I'm getting pretty good at picking out gifts.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I'm sure they'll really enjoy this one too.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Snowsant, we're getting out of the car. If someone sends us a gift, of course we have to return the favor.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: See that truck stopped at the red light? Soon, the tracker's going to be following it all around Siesta.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: We still have a good chunk of morning to enjoy the sunshine in Siesta before they realize something's wrong.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Huh? How can you be so calm even though we're being tailed?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Do we need to completely change our appearance? Get a head-to-toe makeover? Stick to large crowds?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: I don't think we should let any of these minor inconveniences get in the way of our vacation. After all, it's not every day we come to Siesta, and enjoying our trip takes top priority.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Umm... Actually, when I was studying in Columbia, I always wanted to see Siesta but never had the time or money.
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: I heard that when Siesta relocated, they used a special method to bring the volcano along with them, but that sounds kind of crazy...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Is the engineering technology here so advanced that they can build their own artificial mini-volcanoes?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: I assume 'bringing the volcano with them' is just a poetic expression.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: See? Look over there.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: In the midst of the low-rise buildings, taller buildings of various heights vaguely form the shape of a volcano.
People driving along the roads somewhat resemble climbers at the foot of the mountain gazing up at the summit.
There really is a volcano in the middle of the city...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Skyscrapers stand high in the steam from hot springs all over the city... It feels just like a real volcano!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: It goes without saying that you can't just pick up a volcano. But when New Siesta was being built, the buildings in the city center were designed to resemble a volcano. You can say it's a way of paying homage to the past.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: No matter where you go, people always get hung up on this kind of stuff.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: The city's past carries on in its new home, in another form...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Let me see... The place where I'm supposed to meet that city hall guy should be right over here. Give me a minute.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Umm, will someone be coming to pick us up? We're not going to have to walk there ourselves? I even bought two extra buns and ate them this morning to make sure I would have the energy.
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: (Phew... Finally managed to finish unloading the delivery. I might be able to make it in time for my afternoon shift at the post office.)
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: (After that, I should still have time to pick up the two passengers in front of the city. Then, I need to remember to fix up the lights in Rachel's grocery store tonight. Hopefully, that'll be enough to pay off my bills in cash this time.)
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: (I don't have much time left... Need to hurry up...)
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Well, you sure seem to be in a hurry...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Miss Swire, what are you looking at–
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, sorry! I wasn't watching where I was going! You're not hurt, are you?
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: Owwie... Oh, I... I think I'm fine...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Oh right, that's the guy!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Umm...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: That's our driver from city hall!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I beg your pardon? If you're joking around, please don't. I have a ton of work to do and don't have time for that.
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Not a word.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: (Hands over a wad of cash)
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Err...
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: Oh, uhh... Yes, I am...
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: See? I told you someone would be coming to get us.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Umm... I think this is a delivery truck for transporting goods...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: (*whispers*) When I was in Dossoles last time, I was riding around in a heavy boat, on land. Just go with the flow!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: No, screw that! I need to get to my next job, so please...
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: (Hands over another wad of cash)
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: This is your deposit. I've booked your afternoon as well as your vehicle. Now, I'll have you take us around.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: By all means, welcome aboard!
attributes.name: Male Passerby

attributes.content: After several failed attempts to ignite the truck, the man slaps its dashboard vigorously and fiddles with the blinking buttons.
(*whispers*) Miss Swire... Miss Swire! This vehicle seems to have been modified aftermarket and is well beyond its normal service life...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: I really don't know if we can trust this guy!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: What are you talking about?! I'm no worse at souping up cars than any repair shop, and I do it at a fraction of the cost!
attributes.name: Guiltless Man

attributes.content: By the way... My name's Enis.
attributes.name: Guiltless Man

attributes.content: Alright, Enis. Now, it's time for you to prove your skills. Hurry up and start the truck.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: The old pickup truck resembles an aged burdenbeast, its original color faded beyond recognition. After a few heavy gasps, its engine finally sputters to life, carrying the three young people into the distance.
Hello? I'm here.
attributes.name: Tired Government Employee

attributes.content: No sign of her... The big investor from Lungmen...
attributes.name: Tired Government Employee

attributes.content: Yes... I know, she's a very important guest. I'll keep waiting...
attributes.name: Tired Government Employee

attributes.content: I hate my job...
attributes.name: Tired Government Employee

attributes.content: Adele, did you know that the delicate little lines on these rocks contains traces of the earth's respiration across tens of thousands of years?
The continent is not rigid or unchanging. She moves, thinks, and even has emotions, at all times. Beneath her tough skin, she also has a burning-hot heart.
We barely know anything about ourselves, and even less about the very land that has nurtured us.
But, we do have ways of interpreting the language of the earth. To know our land, to communicate with her.
As long you listen carefully, she will reveal to you the wisdom hidden away from human eyes, as well as the secrets about ourselves.
What do you think? Isn't that a magical, wonderful thing?
Adele, don't you want to get to know her better?

A protective suit used for volcanic expeditions is quietly displayed in the exhibition hall, every crease clearly visible beneath the light. It is adorned by cracks and scorch marks, an observable testimony to its past.
It appears rather old, its outline roughly tracing the figure of its owner. It is a figure very familiar to the girl.
How many times had she rushed home to gently knock on the door late in the night, without having time to change out of her sooty clothes?
'Adele, I'm home.'
I still remember that time when me, Katia, and Magna climbed the red volcano.
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: It should've been safe, but a piece of the lava flowing across the ground suddenly splashed out, burning through Magna's sleeve and almost leaving a permanent scar on her arm.
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: We were all terribly frightened. Katia was up-in-arms after that, committed to improving the quality of the volcano expedition team's protective gear, but Magna happily treated the whole thing as a story of her good luck and went around telling the others.
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: She was always so optimistic, stopping at nothing to achieve the goals that she set. She was so brave it was almost scary.
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: But, she'd always make it happen, and it lulled us into thinking that luck would always be on her side.
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: Up until that accident...
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: Adele doesn't speak. She extends her hand carefully. The moment her fingertips make contact with the display case's glass, she quickly pulls her hand back as if she had been burned.
The clothes that were supposed to represent her memories are now hanging in the exhibition hall, a thick and heavy layer of transparent glass separating them from the hands that wish to touch them.
Adele...
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: Long time no see.
attributes.name: Solemn Scholar

attributes.content: Yes, it's been a while, Professor Keller.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I never knew they left anything like this behind...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: After the Mount Unna accident, I found this suit in the warehouse of my research lab at William University in Leithanien.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I was going to send it to you along with the rest of their belongings, but a bit of selfishness kicked in... I wanted to preserve something in their memory.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I should've consulted you beforehand... If you don't want it here, you're more than welcome to take it with you.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: You were my parents' best friend. You worked together for so many years, this suit is part of your shared memories.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: It makes sense to leave this here, as an exhibit...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Those who have left us aren't coming back. Preserving their memory so that others may learn of what they accomplished might be the last thing we can do for them.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Adele looks over at the older scholar beside her, showing no emotion on her dainty features. As if the topic of their conversation was something far, far away from her.

The life story of the suit's owner is written on a plaque in the corner of the exhibit glass. The solemn, cold words recount a tale all too familiar, and the numbers written front-and-center seem almost surreal.
Katia Naumann (1051-1095)
Magna Naumann (1053-1095)
The light overhead blazes, making it somewhat hot. Just like how the heat of lava passes through a protective insulation layer and transfers into the skin.
The reflection off the glass pierces her eyes, and she feels a spell of dizziness.
Adele?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I... I'm fine.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I haven't heard from you since Mutti and Vati passed away... Are you no longer involved in volcano research?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Magna and Katia and I spent more than a decade on those volcanoes. But, I'm not as strong as them. I have no choice but to stop.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: This museum is probably the last thing I can do in the name of volcanic research.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I think I remember you were Siestan.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Yeah. Last year, Herman invited me back to Siesta to build this museum.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: For us Siestans, the volcano was always more than just a disaster that forced us to leave our homes. It's also a memory of the past. The volcano and the city have always been closely connected.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: 'It is not just the objective environment that can bring people together, but memories as well.'
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: That's from the preface of the university's general curriculum textbook, 'Geology and the History of City-States.'
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I see this as an opportunity. I hope this museum can become a place that not only carries the hopes of Siesta, but also showcases the accomplishments of many volcanologists.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: While I was researching Mount Siesta, I happened upon a recommendation report you wrote two years ago – perhaps, a stroke of fate.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: And now Mount Siesta is about to erupt. So, I'd like to invite you to complete this observation with me, as well as finish setting up the museum.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: When the museum was first established, I collected a lot of information related to volcanic geology, and need someone to help me compile all of it into a book.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: It would be my pleasure, Professor Keller.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: As soon as you get away from the heart of the city, the whole place seems completely different.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I see so many shops closing down left-and-right. Seems like business isn't too hot these days?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: It didn't occur to any of us before we moved to the nomadic city. We thought the newly-built hot springs and skyline swimming pools would attract lots of tourists.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Last summer, a whole bunch of people excitedly opened shops all over, but they closed down within months.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: I knew it. An economy heavily dominated by tourism is highly susceptible to changes in the external environment.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: M-Miss Swire, Miss Swire! I-Is there something wrong with this meter? That number up there... what currency is that in? Columbian gold certificates, or Victorian pounds?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: It's... making my head spin...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Young man, ten gold certificates would cover the distance we just traveled back in Columbia, by all reason, and the rates should be even lower here in Siesta.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: We've barely just left, and it's already up to twelve – an extra five now?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: I told you before that I'll compensate you, but if you try to pull a fast one on us, I swear I'll–
attributes.name: Swire
Enis
attributes.content: Wh-What are you doing with that lipstick? I'm not––

attributes.name: Enis
attributes.content: What the hell is that? Okay, sorry! My bad!

attributes.name: Enis
attributes.content: Alright, I tampered with the meter. It's supposed to charge an extra half a cert per mile!
What? You scoundrel...! Half a gold certificate could've bought me two bags of cookies in the store back there!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Come on now, you two. I skipped work to drive you ladies around. It's only fair you give me a little bonus, isn't it...?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Swire turns around and takes a look in the rear-view mirror. A low-key black vehicle is following behind at a distance of roughly three or four car lengths.
(How'd they catch up so quickly...?)
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Young man, I will pay you handsomely, but you've got to listen to me.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Drive a bit faster. Lose that car behind us. Head somewhere crowded, the busier the better.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Um, who exactly are you two...? I'm just trying to do a little side hustle here, I don't want any trouble...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Well, I have no idea what this is about either. We're just a couple of tourists visiting Siesta, and haven't the foggiest why these shady people have been after us ever since we arrived. Maybe they're after our wallets.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: But we don't know our way around this place, and it's awfully frightening...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: (Miss Swire, you were threatening this gentleman with violence just a moment ago...)
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Siesta's tourism industry is already in shambles as it is. Why would anyone be doing stuff like this?!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Let me assure the two of you, at its heart, Siesta is still a tourist city with simple folk customs and beautiful scenery. Please don't go around spreading a negative impression of our city after you get home!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Naturally. That all depends on if we can get the kind-hearted people of Siesta to help us.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Right, sure! If it's for a good and just cause, I'll do everything in my power to help!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Don't you worry. Not even Columbia's greatest racecar driver could catch me on these roads I use for deliveries every day.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Buckle up, you two! I'm gonna step on the gas!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Mr. Mayor.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: The Columbian representative just sent another message and hopes to have another meeting with you in the near future.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: Decline for me.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: They said that Siesta is nominally a part of Columbia, and therefore Congress has a right to the city's latest developments...
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: Tell them to can it. We had a clear agreement when Siesta relocated.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Siesta would retain the status quo with Columbia. They have no right to intervene in our internal affairs, nor do I have to report a thing to them regarding Siesta's plans.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Very well. I'll forward on.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: And yet, you have time for a coffee with me despite your busy schedule. I'm honored.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: I like to set aside some time for quiet contemplation, no matter how busy my schedule is.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: On the other hand, I'd think you wouldn't have much leisure time to spare, Eurill.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: The executive manager of the collaboration between MountainDash Logistics and Siesta is my son. Nominally, even I have no right to interfere with his decisions.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: In other words, there's nothing for you to worry about. Just treat him as you would any other business partner.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: That goes without saying.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: As things are now, Herman, do you regret taking this path?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Across Siesta's history, both Victoria and Columbia have been interested in annexing us.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Had we chosen to fall into the hands of either side, we would have achieved far greater stability and prosperity than today, but this would not be the same Siesta.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: You should be proud of what you've built, Mr. Mayor.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Look, New Siesta is more than a hundred miles from its previous location. If you stand here and look east, you can just barely make out the peak of that volcano.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: If there was a map that could encapsulate this entire land, a line covering a hundred miles wouldn't even be a finger's width, if that.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: But, it is nevertheless possible, and promising, for us to connect with the various countries and city-states scattered across the land. The future proposed by MountainDash Logistics makes me want to believe in that.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: However, we all know full well that this will be a long and difficult road – starting with this present hardship that Siesta must overcome.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: In previous summers, Siesta's streets were crowded with tourists from all over the land, and the sound of concerts could be heard from every corner.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Mister Eurill, do you know the original meaning of the name, 'Siesta'?
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: It's Iberian for 'afternoon nap.'
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: At the time, the Columbians wanted to develop in tandem with Iberia. Though the process was not to their satisfaction, they still ended up settling here.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: That's right. The Pioneers arrived deep in the south and wanted to establish their first home here.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Back then, the workers would get up before dawn to start working, and would take a long break around lunchtime when the sun was the strongest.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Until evening arrived, when people would emerge from their rooms again, drinking coffee to the sea breeze, and preparing for their nightlife.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: I trust that this city, too, is only taking a brief nap. When it next wakes up, it will surely usher in the most beautiful sunset.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: M-Miss Swire... Do we still need to take this detour...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: The number on the meter is already enough for a new truck...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: (How have we not managed to shake them yet?)
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Enis, can you go any faster?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: At this point... I guess I can't say no...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Who could say no...? To a chance to race, do something heroic, and beat back the villains!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Check this out–
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Uwaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh––!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Pleash shlow down a little––
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: ––What wash that shound?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: The vehicle that was tailing them before has disappeared. The delivery truck starts coughing up black smoke and skids to a halt along the side of the road.

Enis pumps the brakes hard as he clutches the steering wheel, wiping the sweat off his brow. Swire pulls Snowsant through the car door and hops out, fearing that the vehicle might explode at any moment.
Fortunately, the worst doesn't come to pass, and the truck finally falls silent after a few frightening whimpers.
My baby!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: I spent two weeks' pay fixing her up last month, and now she's broken down again...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Young man, how do you have the nerve to take this thing on the road when you can lose control just stepping on the gas?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hey, you were the one who asked me to shake them. I would never drive that fast...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: M-Mr. Enis, y-your face is bleeding!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Urgh... I must've hit my nose on the steering wheel just now...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: I, I'll go find some tissue for you!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Both sides of the street are lined with Siesta's old-fashioned beachside shops.

The over-the-top, extravagantly colored parasols and gravel-streaked surfboards seem like they were plucked right out of space and time from the beaches of the past, preserved as specimens, and dragged-and-dropped into a brand new nomadic city.
You said this was supposed to be the hottest spot in all of Siesta?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Did we... get rid of those bad guys?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Shook 'em off a long time ago, my young hero of justice! C'mon, let's find a place to sit, and we'll talk about your truck.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: There should be a restaurant nearby, right...? Huh? Why is there no storefront?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Long time no see, Miss Swire. I heard you'd arrived in Siesta, but the man in charge of your reception wasn't able to find you.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Did you really need to rush out here to meet me in person, Bison? Or, is this your way of showing me your courtesy as landlord?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Let's skip the formalities, Swire. Would you give me a moment of your time?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I'd like to speak with you.
attributes.name: Bison
